intro: Erodium sanguis-christi, commonly known as redstem strewberry, is an annual flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to red flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in gardens and along roadsides. Erodium sanguis-christi is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas.
